intro: Brachistus spruceanus, commonly known as the Spruce's bristlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, bristly leaves and yellow flowers are adapted for efficient pollination by wind and insects. Brachistus spruceanus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
